Class GameOfLife

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameOfLife

  • public class GameOfLife
extends java.lang.Object
    The game board of a finite board emulation of Conway's Game of Life.

    Rules:

    1. Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
    2. Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
    3. Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by over-population.
    4. Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

    Since:
    2016-03-08

      • setSquareAt

        public void setSquareAt(int x,
                        int y,
                        boolean state)
        Set a certain square to live or dead.
        Parameters:
        x - x dimension to set at.
        y - y dimension to set at.
        state - true for live cell, false for dead.

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        Draw the board without grid. Used while running the game.

      • drawGridBoard

        public void drawGridBoard()
        Draw board with grid and numbering. Used for printing the board when inputting squares, and for debugging purposes.

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard()
        Updates next state of the board following the rules of Conway's Game of Life.

        Calculate next states, update to next states, ready to draw board again. Rules:

        1. Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbors dies, as if by under population.
        2. Any live cell with two or three live neighbors lives on to the next generation.
        3. Any live cell with more than three live neighbors dies, as if by overpopulation.
        4. Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbors becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

      • sumNeighbours

        public int sumNeighbours(int x,
                         int y)
        Sum up number of live neighbours, follwing the rules of Conway's Game of Life.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of square
        y - y coordinate of square
        Returns:
        number of live neighbours.

      • checkBounds

        public boolean checkBounds(int x,
                           int y)
        Check if an (x,y) pair exists within the bounds of the board.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate to check.
        y - y coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        true for within board, false for outside.
